title: Plain pizza

properties.name: description
properties.value: Plain pizzas are a type of food that can be obtained by baking an uncooked pizza on a cooking range, requiring level 35 Cooking and granting 143 experience when successful. Players may burn the pizza while cooking one, resulting in burnt pizza; the burn rate while cooking these will decrease as players reach higher Cooking levels. It will stop burning entirely at Cooking level 68 on ranges.

SMW Subobject for HalfHigh Alchemy value: 12Examine: Half of this plain pizza has been eaten.Is members only: falseIs variant of: Plain pizzaUses infobox: ItemImage: File:1-2 plain pizza.pngWeight: 0.400Value: 20Version anchor: HalfRelease date: 29 March 2004Item ID: 2291

Plain pizzas are a type of food that can be obtained by baking an uncooked pizza on a cooking range, requiring level 35 Cooking and granting 143 experience when successful. Players may burn the pizza while cooking one, resulting in burnt pizza; the burn rate while cooking these will decrease as players reach higher Cooking levels. It will stop burning entirely at Cooking level 68 on ranges.

Plain pizza is eaten in two halves, each half healing 7 Hitpoints. Plain pizza can be bought from Lidio, in the Warriors' Guild, who has a stock of 5.

Several steps are required in a particular order to make a plain pizza from scratch:

  1. Use a pot of flour with either a bucket of water, bowl of water, or jug of water to create a pizza base
  2. Add a tomato to the pizza base to create an incomplete pizza
  3. Add a cheese to the incomplete pizza to create an uncooked pizza
  4. Use the uncooked pizza on a range to create the plain pizza (or, if burnt, a burnt pizza)

The plain pizza can then be used to create pizzas with topping (meat pizza, anchovy pizza and pineapple pizza), see the Products section.

Contents

  • 1 Creation
    • 1.1 Cooking chance

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
13 August 2015
(update | poll)

Pizza will now remain in the same inventory slot after the first half is eaten.

26 February 2015
(update)

The 1/2 plain pizza was made untradeable on the Trading Post/Grand Exchange.

3 September 2014 - 14 April 2015
(poll)

Pizza halves can be combined to create a full pizza.

17 November 2004
(update)

The 1/2 plain pizza was graphically updated.

29 March 2004
(update)

The 1/2 plain pizza became permanently available with the launch of RuneScape 2.

1 December 2003
(update)

The 1/2 plain pizza was added to the RuneScape 2 Beta.
